title: [$250] Android-Reports-Empty space seen when deleting expense on "Group-by" filter and resetting it

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory with https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75962 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2180@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create three manual expenses. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Tap on "Filters" > "Group By" 6. Tap on "From" and select "Save" 7. Apply the filter. 8. Expand the displayed results. 9. Long tap and select one of the expenses on result. 10. Tap on dropdown menu and delete the expense. 11. Tap on the "Group by" exposed filter and reset it. 12. Note that when you land on "Expenses", only one expense is visible and empty space is visible between expense and exposed filters. ## Expected Result: When using the "Group-by" filter and deleting one expense on the results, no empty space should be created after resetting filter, and remaining expenses should still be correctly visible on expenses list. ## Actual Result: When resetting the "Group-by" filter after deleting an expense on the results, only one of the remaining expenses is visible on expenses list, and an empty space is visible between this expense and exposed filters. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/82aec34a-7409-4a25-973d-b2eecdaa97f4 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [HOLD][$250][Unreported] Handle per diem expenses when moving expenses in bulk via Reports page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
Held on https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/76990


# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project
Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162
Doc section:
Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162

# Feature Description
When the user moves expenses in bulk on the Reports page, we want to check if there are per diem expenses in the batch of moved expenses. If there are per diems, we allow moving only if all of them belong to the same workspace and the target report is also tied to the workspace where the per diems were created. Otherwise, we want to show an error modal explaining that it is not possible to move per diem expenses to a different workspace.


<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>

title: [$250] [Unreported] Show an alert popup when the user tries moving a per diem expense to a different workspace

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 Doc section: Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 # Feature Description A per diem expense can be moved only to a report that is tied to the workspace where the expense was created. This adds an alert modal that informs the user that it is not possible to move per diem expenses to other workspaces. This is needed for parity with Classic. The following popup is displayed in Classic ### A. User has no workspace with per diem enabled

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sodisnoisjosijdio@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Invoice is enabled. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Submit an expense without merchant to another user. 3. Open IOU report. 4. Click Merchant. 5. Without entering anything, click Save. → System message shows "removed the merchant (previously "Expense")". 6. Open FAB > Send invoice. 7. Send an invoice to any user. 8. Open invoice report. 9. Click Merchant. 10. Without entering anything, click Save. → System message shows "removed the merchant (previously "Expense")". ## Expected Result: There should be no system message when user saves merchant without editing it. ## Actual Result: System message shows "removed the merchant (previously "Expense")" when user saves merchant without editing it. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a5579dc-8edb-4dc8-89cf-eb4cf94a7497 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** N **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75542 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+sjnoinsddjss22@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in with Expensifail account. - Workspace has at least two distance rates 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat 3. Click + > Track distance > Manual 4. Enter non-zero distance > Next 5. Click Create expense 6. Open the transaction thread 7. Click Distance 8. Change the distance to 0 and save it 9. Click Rate 10. Select other rate ## Expected Result: Amount field will remain 0 after changing distance to 0 and changing rate ## Actual Result: Amount field reverts to original amount after changing distance to 0 and changing rate ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.73-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2305/folder/13176877/41237352/1060192920 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2180@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has Self DM. Prerequisite 2: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Create a manual expense without category and submit it to Self DM. 3. Tap on "Submit it to someone" on the actionable whisper below expense preview. 4. Select any workspace. 5. Once on "Confirm Page" note that category field shows "Uncategorized" 6. Try to submit expense. 7. Note that a "Category no longer valid" error appears on category field and at the bottom of the page. ## Expected Result: "Category" field should be displayed empty when submitting track expense to someone if user didn´t add any category yet, ## Actual Result: "Category" field shows "Uncategorized" con confirm page while submitting track expense to someone, and if user tries to submit expense without adding any category, a "Category no longer valid" error appears on "Category" field and at the bottom of report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bacda1df-aebc-49c4-9866-86f4550e091e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Add GL code to tag and category table

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

body:
Similarly how we've added `Custom field 1` and `Custom field 2` to the Members table in `Workspaces -> Workspace -> Members`, let's add the GL code to `Workspaces -> Workspace -> Tags` and `Workspaces -> Workspace -> Categories`. On mobile we'll hide it and not show it. This is mostly just to show more information on desktop where we have the space. cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr
